21// Helper function for ToPropertyDescriptor. Comments describe steps for
22// "enumerable", other properties are handled the same way.
23// Returns false if an exception was thrown.
24bool GetPropertyIfPresent(Handle<JSReceiver> receiver, Handle<String> name,
25 Handle<Object>* value) {
26 LookupIterator it(receiver->GetIsolate(), receiver, name, receiver);
27 // 4. Let hasEnumerable be HasProperty(Obj, "enumerable").
28 Maybe<bool> has_property = JSReceiver::HasProperty(&it);
29 // 5. ReturnIfAbrupt(hasEnumerable).
30 if (has_property.IsNothing()) return false;
31 // 6. If hasEnumerable is true, then
32 if (has_property.FromJust() == true) {
33 // 6a. Let enum be ToBoolean(Get(Obj, "enumerable")).
34 // 6b. ReturnIfAbrupt(enum).
35 if (!Object::GetProperty(&it).ToHandle(value)) return false;
36 }
37 return true;
38}
39
40// Helper function for ToPropertyDescriptor. Handles the case of "simple"
41// objects: nothing on the prototype chain, just own fast data properties.
42// Must not have observable side effects, because the slow path will restart
43// the entire conversion!
44bool ToPropertyDescriptorFastPath(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSReceiver> obj,
45 PropertyDescriptor* desc) {
46 {
47 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
48 Tagged<JSReceiver> raw_obj = *obj;
49 if (!IsJSObject(*raw_obj)) return false;
50 Tagged<Map> raw_map = raw_obj->map(isolate);
51 if (raw_map->instance_type() != JS_OBJECT_TYPE) return false;
52 if (raw_map->is_access_check_needed()) return false;
53 if (raw_map->prototype() != *isolate->initial_object_prototype())
54 return false;
55 // During bootstrapping, the object_function_prototype_map hasn't been
56 // set up yet.
57 if (isolate->bootstrapper()->IsActive()) return false;
58 if (JSObject::cast(raw_map->prototype())->map() !=
59 isolate->raw_native_context()->object_function_prototype_map()) {
60 return false;
61 }
62 // TODO(jkummerow): support dictionary properties?
63 if (raw_map->is_dictionary_map()) return false;
64 }
65
66 Handle<Map> map(obj->map(isolate), isolate);
67
68 Handle<DescriptorArray> descs =
69 Handle<DescriptorArray>(map->instance_descriptors(isolate), isolate);
70 ReadOnlyRoots roots(isolate);
71 for (InternalIndex i : map->IterateOwnDescriptors()) {
72 PropertyDetails details = descs->GetDetails(i);
73 Handle<Object> value;
74 if (details.location() == PropertyLocation::kField) {
75 if (details.kind() == PropertyKind::kData) {
76 value = JSObject::FastPropertyAt(isolate, Handle<JSObject>::cast(obj),
77 details.representation(),
78 FieldIndex::ForDetails(*map, details));
79 } else {
80 DCHECK_EQ(PropertyKind::kAccessor, details.kind());
81 // Bail out to slow path.
82 return false;
83 }
84
85 } else {
86 DCHECK_EQ(PropertyLocation::kDescriptor, details.location());
87 if (details.kind() == PropertyKind::kData) {
88 value = handle(descs->GetStrongValue(i), isolate);
89 } else {
90 DCHECK_EQ(PropertyKind::kAccessor, details.kind());
91 // Bail out to slow path.
92 return false;
93 }
94 }
95 Tagged<Name> key = descs->GetKey(i);
96 if (key == roots.enumerable_string()) {
97 desc->set_enumerable(Object::BooleanValue(*value, isolate));
98 } else if (key == roots.configurable_string()) {
99 desc->set_configurable(Object::BooleanValue(*value, isolate));
100 } else if (key == roots.value_string()) {
101 desc->set_value(value);
102 } else if (key == roots.writable_string()) {
103 desc->set_writable(Object::BooleanValue(*value, isolate));
104 } else if (key == roots.get_string()) {
105 // Bail out to slow path to throw an exception if necessary.
106 if (!IsCallable(*value)) return false;
107 desc->set_get(value);
108 } else if (key == roots.set_string()) {
109 // Bail out to slow path to throw an exception if necessary.
110 if (!IsCallable(*value)) return false;
111 desc->set_set(value);
112 }
113 }
114 if ((desc->has_get() || desc->has_set()) &&
115 (desc->has_value() || desc->has_writable())) {
116 // Bail out to slow path to throw an exception.
117 return false;
118 }
119 return true;
120}
121
122void CreateDataProperty(Handle<JSObject> object, Handle<String> name,
123 Handle<Object> value) {
124 Isolate* isolate = object->GetIsolate();
125 Maybe<bool> result = JSObject::CreateDataProperty(
126 isolate, object, PropertyKey(isolate, Handle<Name>::cast(name)), value);
127 CHECK(result.IsJust() && result.FromJust());
128}
129
130} // namespace
131
132// ES6 6.2.4.4 "FromPropertyDescriptor"
133Handle<Object> PropertyDescriptor::ToObject(Isolate* isolate) {
134 DCHECK(!(PropertyDescriptor::IsAccessorDescriptor(this) &&
135 PropertyDescriptor::IsDataDescriptor(this)));
136 Factory* factory = isolate->factory();
137 if (IsRegularAccessorProperty()) {
138 // Fast case for regular accessor properties.
139 Handle<JSObject> result = factory->NewJSObjectFromMap(
140 isolate->accessor_property_descriptor_map());
141 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(JSAccessorPropertyDescriptor::kGetIndex,
142 *get());
143 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(JSAccessorPropertyDescriptor::kSetIndex,
144 *set());
145 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(
146 JSAccessorPropertyDescriptor::kEnumerableIndex,
147 isolate->heap()->ToBoolean(enumerable()));
148 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(
149 JSAccessorPropertyDescriptor::kConfigurableIndex,
150 isolate->heap()->ToBoolean(configurable()));
151 return result;
152 }
153 if (IsRegularDataProperty()) {
154 // Fast case for regular data properties.
155 Handle<JSObject> result =
156 factory->NewJSObjectFromMap(isolate->data_property_descriptor_map());
157 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(JSDataPropertyDescriptor::kValueIndex,
158 *value());
159 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(JSDataPropertyDescriptor::kWritableIndex,
160 isolate->heap()->ToBoolean(writable()));
161 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(JSDataPropertyDescriptor::kEnumerableIndex,
162 isolate->heap()->ToBoolean(enumerable()));
163 result->InObjectPropertyAtPut(JSDataPropertyDescriptor::kConfigurableIndex,
164 isolate->heap()->ToBoolean(configurable()));
165 return result;
166 }
167 Handle<JSObject> result = factory->NewJSObject(isolate->object_function());
168 if (has_value()) {
169 CreateDataProperty(result, factory->value_string(), value());
170 }
171 if (has_writable()) {
172 CreateDataProperty(result, factory->writable_string(),
173 factory->ToBoolean(writable()));
174 }
175 if (has_get()) {
176 CreateDataProperty(result, factory->get_string(), get());
177 }
178 if (has_set()) {
179 CreateDataProperty(result, factory->set_string(), set());
180 }
181 if (has_enumerable()) {
182 CreateDataProperty(result, factory->enumerable_string(),
183 factory->ToBoolean(enumerable()));
184 }
185 if (has_configurable()) {
186 CreateDataProperty(result, factory->configurable_string(),
187 factory->ToBoolean(configurable()));
188 }
189 return result;
190}
191
192// ES6 6.2.4.5
193// Returns false in case of exception.
194// static
195bool PropertyDescriptor::ToPropertyDescriptor(Isolate* isolate,
196 Handle<Object> obj,
197 PropertyDescriptor* desc) {
198 // 1. ReturnIfAbrupt(Obj).
199 // 2. If Type(Obj) is not Object, throw a TypeError exception.
200 if (!IsJSReceiver(*obj)) {
201 isolate->Throw(*isolate->factory()->NewTypeError(
202 MessageTemplate::kPropertyDescObject, obj));
203 return false;
204 }
205 // 3. Let desc be a new Property Descriptor that initially has no fields.
206 DCHECK(desc->is_empty());
207
208 Handle<JSReceiver> receiver = Handle<JSReceiver>::cast(obj);
209 if (ToPropertyDescriptorFastPath(isolate, receiver, desc)) {
210 return true;
211 }
212
213 // enumerable?
214 Handle<Object> enumerable;
215 // 4 through 6b.
216 if (!GetPropertyIfPresent(receiver, isolate->factory()->enumerable_string(),
217 &enumerable)) {
218 return false;
219 }
220 // 6c. Set the [[Enumerable]] field of desc to enum.
221 if (!enumerable.is_null()) {
222 desc->set_enumerable(Object::BooleanValue(*enumerable, isolate));
223 }
224
225 // configurable?
226 Handle<Object> configurable;
227 // 7 through 9b.
228 if (!GetPropertyIfPresent(receiver, isolate->factory()->configurable_string(),
229 &configurable)) {
230 return false;
231 }
232 // 9c. Set the [[Configurable]] field of desc to conf.
233 if (!configurable.is_null()) {
234 desc->set_configurable(Object::BooleanValue(*configurable, isolate));
235 }
236
237 // value?
238 Handle<Object> value;
239 // 10 through 12b.
240 if (!GetPropertyIfPresent(receiver, isolate->factory()->value_string(),
241 &value)) {
242 return false;
243 }
244 // 12c. Set the [[Value]] field of desc to value.
245 if (!value.is_null()) desc->set_value(value);
246
247 // writable?
248 Handle<Object> writable;
249 // 13 through 15b.
250 if (!GetPropertyIfPresent(receiver, isolate->factory()->writable_string(),
251 &writable)) {
252 return false;
253 }
254 // 15c. Set the [[Writable]] field of desc to writable.
255 if (!writable.is_null())
256 desc->set_writable(Object::BooleanValue(*writable, isolate));
257
258 // getter?
259 Handle<Object> getter;
260 // 16 through 18b.
261 if (!GetPropertyIfPresent(receiver, isolate->factory()->get_string(),
262 &getter)) {
263 return false;
264 }
265 if (!getter.is_null()) {
266 // 18c. If IsCallable(getter) is false and getter is not undefined,
267 // throw a TypeError exception.
268 if (!IsCallable(*getter) && !IsUndefined(*getter, isolate)) {
269 isolate->Throw(*isolate->factory()->NewTypeError(
270 MessageTemplate::kObjectGetterCallable, getter));
271 return false;
272 }
273 // 18d. Set the [[Get]] field of desc to getter.
274 desc->set_get(getter);
275 }
276 // setter?
277 Handle<Object> setter;
278 // 19 through 21b.
279 if (!GetPropertyIfPresent(receiver, isolate->factory()->set_string(),
280 &setter)) {
281 return false;
282 }
283 if (!setter.is_null()) {
284 // 21c. If IsCallable(setter) is false and setter is not undefined,
285 // throw a TypeError exception.
286 if (!IsCallable(*setter) && !IsUndefined(*setter, isolate)) {
287 isolate->Throw(*isolate->factory()->NewTypeError(
288 MessageTemplate::kObjectSetterCallable, setter));
289 return false;
290 }
291 // 21d. Set the [[Set]] field of desc to setter.
292 desc->set_set(setter);
293 }
294
295 // 22. If either desc.[[Get]] or desc.[[Set]] is present, then
296 // 22a. If either desc.[[Value]] or desc.[[Writable]] is present,
297 // throw a TypeError exception.
298 if ((desc->has_get() || desc->has_set()) &&
299 (desc->has_value() || desc->has_writable())) {
300 isolate->Throw(*isolate->factory()->NewTypeError(
301 MessageTemplate::kValueAndAccessor, obj));
302 return false;
303 }
304
305 // 23. Return desc.
306 return true;
307}
308
309// ES6 6.2.4.6
310// static
311void PropertyDescriptor::CompletePropertyDescriptor(Isolate* isolate,
312 PropertyDescriptor* desc) {
313 // 1. ReturnIfAbrupt(Desc).
314 // 2. Assert: Desc is a Property Descriptor.
315 // 3. Let like be Record{
316 // [[Value]]: undefined, [[Writable]]: false,
317 // [[Get]]: undefined, [[Set]]: undefined,
318 // [[Enumerable]]: false, [[Configurable]]: false}.
319 // 4. If either IsGenericDescriptor(Desc) or IsDataDescriptor(Desc) is true,
320 // then:
321 if (!IsAccessorDescriptor(desc)) {
322 // 4a. If Desc does not have a [[Value]] field, set Desc.[[Value]] to
323 // like.[[Value]].
324 if (!desc->has_value()) {
325 desc->set_value(isolate->factory()->undefined_value());
326 }
327 // 4b. If Desc does not have a [[Writable]] field, set Desc.[[Writable]]
328 // to like.[[Writable]].
329 if (!desc->has_writable()) desc->set_writable(false);
330 } else {
331 // 5. Else,
332 // 5a. If Desc does not have a [[Get]] field, set Desc.[[Get]] to
333 // like.[[Get]].
334 if (!desc->has_get()) {
335 desc->set_get(isolate->factory()->undefined_value());
336 }
337 // 5b. If Desc does not have a [[Set]] field, set Desc.[[Set]] to
338 // like.[[Set]].
339 if (!desc->has_set()) {
340 desc->set_set(isolate->factory()->undefined_value());
341 }
342 }
343 // 6. If Desc does not have an [[Enumerable]] field, set
344 // Desc.[[Enumerable]] to like.[[Enumerable]].
345 if (!desc->has_enumerable()) desc->set_enumerable(false);
346 // 7. If Desc does not have a [[Configurable]] field, set
347 // Desc.[[Configurable]] to like.[[Configurable]].
348 if (!desc->has_configurable()) desc->set_configurable(false);
349 // 8. Return Desc.
350}
351
352Handle<PropertyDescriptorObject> PropertyDescriptor::ToPropertyDescriptorObject(
353 Isolate* isolate) {
354 Handle<PropertyDescriptorObject> obj =
355 isolate->factory()->NewPropertyDescriptorObject();
356
357 int flags =
358 PropertyDescriptorObject::IsEnumerableBit::encode(enumerable_) |
359 PropertyDescriptorObject::HasEnumerableBit::encode(has_enumerable_) |
360 PropertyDescriptorObject::IsConfigurableBit::encode(configurable_) |
361 PropertyDescriptorObject::HasConfigurableBit::encode(has_configurable_) |
362 PropertyDescriptorObject::IsWritableBit::encode(writable_) |
363 PropertyDescriptorObject::HasWritableBit::encode(has_writable_) |
364 PropertyDescriptorObject::HasValueBit::encode(has_value()) |
365 PropertyDescriptorObject::HasGetBit::encode(has_get()) |
366 PropertyDescriptorObject::HasSetBit::encode(has_set());
367
368 obj->set_flags(flags);
369
370 if (has_value()) obj->set_value(*value_);
371 if (has_get()) obj->set_get(*get_);
372 if (has_set()) obj->set_set(*set_);
373
374 return obj;
375}
